item.title: 2nd Kagerou Project x 18 Collaboration
item.dc:creator: Jade Kaiba
item.description:
The 2nd Kagerou Project x 18 Collaboration has begun! 18 is a mobile puzzle game created by Tetsuya Mizuguchi, the creator of Rez and Child of Eden, and is available on Android and iOS devices. The gameplay features matching puzzles as well as battle RPG elements and a story with dialogue options. New Characters During …

The post 2nd Kagerou Project x 18 Collaboration appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The 2nd Kagerou Project x 18 Collaboration has begun!

18 is a mobile puzzle game created by Tetsuya Mizuguchi, the creator of Rez and Child of Eden, and is available on Android and iOS devices.

The gameplay features matching puzzles as well as battle RPG elements and a story with dialogue options.

New Characters

During the collaboration period, newly drawn characters will be added to the game, including ‘Seto and Mary’ and ‘Ayano’. These new illustrations were created by the 18 puzzle production staff so the designs may differ slightly from the original designs.

Here are some more images of the new character illustrations as they appear in the game.

 

 

New Quest

As part of the collaboration, a new Kagerou Project quest will also be available in the game.

The quest will feature a popular Kagerou Project character as a BOSS and an original story only available through this collaboration.

While playing the new quest, you can listen to the unreleased song ‘Children Records IA & ONE version’.

The song features lyrics and composition from Jin, as well as VOCALOID programming by Ciel, aka. Kannazuki P.

If you clear the quest during the collaboration period, you will receive a Kagerou Project (2nd) Ticket.

The ticket which can be used with the Kagerou Project (2nd Bullet) gacha in exchange for one of the limited edition Kagerou Project divers.

Please note that you must complete the mission within the collaboration period to receive the ticket.

Even if you complete the mission after the collaboration period ends, you will not receive the ticket.

Twitter Campaign

Players can gain further rewards by participating in the Twitter commemoration campaign.

During the collaboration period, the 18 official Twitter account will post a tweet calling for retweets.

For every 1000 retweets up to 5000, players will be rewarded with 1 Dream Drop.

Additionally, there will be a new mission available in the game every day during the collaboration period.

Completing the mission will prompt the player to post a Tweet, and, if you do so, you will be rewarded with 100 Dream Drop Fragments.

Please note that these are daily missions so this can only be done once per day.

Quiz Reward

On the Quest Page, there will also be a quiz about the second chapter of the Kagerou Project quest.

If you answer the quiz with ’18パズル公式LINE@のトーク’ or ‘夢世界の記憶’, you shall receive 1 Dream Drop as a reward.

In addition, users who answer by Wednesday, September 20th at 23:59 JST will be entered into a lottery, where the winners will receive a Kagerou Project Ticket (2nd).

Collaboration Period

The Kagerou Project x 18 Collaboration period will run from:

Monday, September 11th at 18:00 JST – Sunday, September 24th at 23:59 JST

More information

For more information on 18 and other events, check out their website below.

Visit the Official 18 Website

The post 2nd Kagerou Project x 18 Collaboration appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Kagepro Merch Bundles Now Available at TOM
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
Fans of Kagepro who’ve always wanted Animate exclusive merchandise can now purchase select Kagepro merch bundles at prices much lower than retail prices. Quantities are limited on these bundles! Kagerou Project Stationery Set, MSRP: $17.99: Includes the following items: Ringed notebook (randomly chosen from three designs) Sticky note set 2 clear files (randomly chosen from …

The post Kagepro Merch Bundles Now Available at TOM appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Fans of Kagepro who’ve always wanted Animate exclusive merchandise can now purchase select Kagepro merch bundles at prices much lower than retail prices. Quantities are limited on these bundles!

Kagerou Project Stationery Set, MSRP: $17.99: Includes the following items:

  • Ringed notebook (randomly chosen from three designs)
  • Sticky note set
  • 2 clear files (randomly chosen from 13 designs)
  • Pencil board (randomly chosen from 9 designs)

Kagerou Project Accessory Set, MSRP: $25.99. Includes the following items:

  • Set of 3 badges (randomly chosen from 2 sets)
  • Earphone cord holder
  • Cell phone strap (randomly chosen from 9 designs)
  • Rubber strap (randomly chosen from 4 designs)

 

Kagerou Project Vinyl Sailor Bag Merch Set, MSRP: $42.99. Includes the following items:

  • Wind chime (randomly chosen from 2 designs)
  • Fan (randomly chosen from 8 designs)
  • Mekakushi dan mini towel (randomly chosen from 10 designs)
  • Ene vinyl sailor bag

 

Kagerou Project Merch Sets 1, 2, and 3, MSRP: $45.99 for Sets 1 and 3, $48.99 for Set 2.

Set 1 includes the following items:

  • Mekakushi Dan mini towel (randomly chosen from 10 designs)
  • Scrunchie (randomly chosen from 4 designs)
  • Pouch (randomly chosen from 2 designs)
  • Mekakucity Days CD-shaped mirror

Set 2 includes the following items:

  • Lunch box set (randomly chosen from 4 designs)
  • Mekakushi Dan original bottle holder
  • Aun hand towel

Set 3 includes the following items:

  • Konoha & Haruka tapestry
  • Mug
  • Mekakushi Dan in Summer tapestry
  • Mekakucity Days CD-shaped mirror

Kagerou Project Tote Bag Merch Set, MSRP: $73.99. Includes the following items:

  • IC card stickers
  • Pass case
  • Ene rubber key case
  • Ene tote bag

Original post from Vocaloid Buy Blog. Reposted with permission.

The post Kagepro Merch Bundles Now Available at TOM appeared first on VNN.

item.title: IA Holiday Events and 2016 Asian Tour Announced
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
Recently, IA's Global Facebook page announced that the virtual singer will continue to make "appearances" at three Kinokuniya bookstores across the United States this month. During these special holiday events, they will premier the live footage from IA’s U.S. debut concert held at Club Nokia - L.A. Live during Anime Expo on July 4th, 2015.

The post IA Holiday Events and 2016 Asian Tour Announced appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Recently, IA’s Global Facebook page announced that the virtual singer will continue to make “appearances” at three Kinokuniya bookstores across the United States this month. During these special holiday events, they will premier the live footage from IA’s U.S. debut concert held at Club Nokia – L.A. Live during Anime Expo on July 4th, 2015. All three stores will also carry special IA merchandise as well as Kagerou Project original goods sold at the 1st Place Official Shop “HACHIMAKI” and various conventions throughout the year.

In addition, the official press release also mentions a joint tour featuring both IA and her voice provider Lia. There aren’t many details available at the moment but we do know it will be an Asian tour. However, the press release also notes:

“As the details of their first Asian Tour are being revealed, fans in the US can also look forward to see her (and maybe LIA?) in 2016!”

So there is a chance of there being at least one stop in the U.S. However, nothing has been guaranteed at the moment.

Event Times and Dates

Admission to all of the events listed below is free.

Seattle Store

Location: Uwajimaya Village
525 South Weller St, Seattle (tel: 206-587-2477)
Time and Date: Saturday, December 12 from 2pm to 3pm

New York City Store

Location: 1073 Ave of the Americas (between 40th & 41st St) NYC (tel: 212-869-1700)
Time and Date: Saturday, December 12th from 6pm to 7pm

San Francisco Store

Location: Japan Center – Kinokuniya Building
1581 Webster St (between Geary Blvd & Post St), San Francisco (tel: 415-567-7625)
Time and Date: Friday, December 18th from 6pm to 7pm

Goods You Can Expect

This isn’t the first time that 1st Place has sold merchandise in the United States. Though we can’t give any definite answers as to what will be there, the IA World Page has posted pictures of merchandise sold at Kinokuniya stores during past events.

https://www.facebook.com/IA.WORLD.PAGE/photos/a.1738315193061683.1073741833.1542120009347870/1738315296395006/?type=3&permPage=1

The post IA Holiday Events and 2016 Asian Tour Announced appeared first on VNN.
